Clio.Note: Get access token from Clio OAuth 2.0 flow at https://app.clio.com/oauth/authorize
Instructions: 2. Create a new application in your developer portal
3. Get OAuth 2.0 access token through authorization flow
4. Required scopes: users, contacts, matters, billing (adjust per needs)

NetSuite.Note: Use Token-Based Authentication (TBA) credentials from NetSuite
Instructions: 1. Go to Setup > Integration > Manage Integrations > New
2. Create integration record with Token-Based Authentication
3. Create role with Web Services permissions (Full level required)
4. Go to Setup > Users/Roles > Access Tokens > New
5. Select your integration and user/role, generate tokens

QuickBooks.Note: Use OAuth 2.0 credentials from QuickBooks developer portal
Instructions: 2. Create new app with QuickBooks Online Accounting scope
3. Use OAuth 2.0 flow to get access token and company ID
4. For production, change BaseURL to https://quickbooks.api.intuit.com
5. Company ID found in QB URL or via CTRL+ALT+? in QuickBooks
